newsitem: Meta bans Russian state media
title: Me tabans Russian state media for 'foreign interference'

newsitem: Meta bans Russian state media
description: Facebook owner Meta said on Monday it was banning RT, Rossiya Segodnya and other Russian state media networks from its platforms, claiming the outlets had used deceptive tactics to carry out covert influence operations online.

newsitem: Meta bans Russian state media
description: The ban, strongly criticised by the Kremlin, marks a sharp escalation in measures by the world's biggest social media company against Russian state media, after years of more limited steps such as blocking the outlets from running ads and reducing the reach of their posts.

newsitem: Meta bans Russian state media
description: "After careful consideration, we expanded our ongoing enforcement against Russian state media outlets. Rossiya Segodnya, RT and other related entities are now banned from our apps globally for foreign interference activity," the social media company said in a written statement.

newsitem: Meta bans Russian state media
description: A spokesperson for Alphabet's YouTube also said the company terminated over 230 channels affiliated with Rossiya Segodnya and AVO TV Novosti, which were already blocked from viewers.

newsitem: Meta bans Russian state media
description: In addition to Facebook, Meta's apps include Instagram, WhatsApp and Threads. Prior to the ban, RT had more than 7.2 million followers on Facebook and more than 1 million followers on Instagram.

newsitem: Meta bans Russian state media
description: Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov told reporters on Tuesday: "Meta is discrediting itself with these actions. Such selective actions against Russian media are unacceptable. ... This complicates prospects for normalising our relations with Meta."

newsitem: Meta bans Russian state media
description: Moscow branded Meta an "extremist" organisation in 2022 and blocked Instagram and Facebook, objecting to changes in Meta's hate speech policy designed to allow users to vent their anger over Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

newsitem: Meta bans Russian state media
description: Russia has also criticised previous efforts by Meta to limit the reach of Russian media and fined the company several times for not removing content in Russia it considers illegal.

newsitem: Meta bans Russian state media
description: Moscow's pre-existing bans on Instagram and Facebook may limit its ability to respond to Meta's state media block, but WhatsApp, which Russia has stopped short of banning so far, is used by millions of Russians.

newsitem: Meta bans Russian state media
description: Telegram Messenger, whose Russian founder Pavel Durov was placed under formal investigation in France last month, is also widely used in Russia.

newsitem: Meta bans Russian state media
description: VK Video, run by state-controlled tech firm VK, offers an alternative to YouTube, which has come under pressure in Russia over its own efforts to block Russian state media.

newsitem: Meta bans Russian state media
description: The White House declined to comment on Meta's move, which came after the United States filed money-laundering charges against two RT employees for what officials said was a scheme to hire an American company to produce online content to influence the 2024 election.

newsitem: Meta bans Russian state media
description: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken said on Friday that countries should treat RT's activities as they do covert intelligence operations.

newsitem: Meta bans Russian state media

newsitem: Meta bans Russian state media

Brazil's court threatens X with hefty fine
title: Brazil's top court threatens X with hefty fine for bypassing ban

newsitem: Brazil's court threatens X with hefty fine
description: Brazil's Supreme Court ordered Elon Musk-owned X not to circumvent a previous ruling suspending the social media platform in the country, at risk of a daily fine of 5 million reais ($921,726.95), according to a decision issued late on Wednesday.

newsitem: Brazil's court threatens X with hefty fine
description: X became accessible to many users in Brazil on Wednesday after an update to its communications network bypassed the court-ordered block. A 5-million-real fine has already been imposed because of that action, according to the decision.

newsitem: Brazil's court threatens X with hefty fine
description: In August, after a months-long dispute between Musk and Brazilian Justice Alexandre de Moraes, the Supreme Court ordered Brazil's mobile and internet service providers to block the platform, cutting users off within hours.

newsitem: Brazil's court threatens X with hefty fine
description: "There is no doubt that X, under Elon Musk's direct command, again intends to disrespect Brazil's Judiciary," Moraes wrote in his latest order, saying the platform had a "strategy" to circumvent the ban.

newsitem: Brazil's court threatens X with hefty fine
description: X said on Wednesday that a switch in network providers had resulted in "an inadvertent and temporary service restoration" in Brazil, adding that it is maintaining efforts to work with the Brazilian government to resume service there "very soon".

newsitem: Brazil's court threatens X with hefty fine
description: Brazilian law office Pinheiro Neto Advogados, which is representing X in the Brazilian Supreme Court, declined to comment on Thursday.

newsitem: Brazil's court threatens X with hefty fine
description: Courts have previously blocked accounts implicated in probes of allegedly spreading misinformation and hate, which Musk has denounced as censorship, and they have ordered X to name a local representative as required by Brazilian law.

newsitem: Brazil's court threatens X with hefty fine
description: The national telecommunications agency Anatel said in a statement that it is working to block X's access in Brazil through Cloudflare, the content delivery network the platform used to circumvent the block. This will likely happen by the end of Thursday, according to a person familiar with the situation.

newsitem: Brazil's court threatens X with hefty fine
description: Other platforms, such as Fastly and EdgeUno, may have also been tapped by X to bypass the law, according to authorities.

newsitem: Brazil's court threatens X with hefty fine
description: Anatel is contacting San Francisco-based Fastly and Brazil's EdgeUno on Thursday to confirm if those platforms are providing unlawful access to X, the person familiar with the situation told Reuters.

newsitem: Brazil's court threatens X with hefty fine
description: Anatel reached Cloudflare on Wednesday, and the company agreed to collaborate with Brazilian authorities, the person said, adding that the suspension of services would not jeopardise access to other networks that may use the same cloud service.

title: Ukraine bans official use of Telegram app over fears of Russian spying

newsitem: Ukraine bans Telegram use due to spying concerns
description: Ukraine has banned use of the Telegram messaging app on official devices used by state officials, military personnel and critical workers because it believes its enemy Russia can spy on both messages and users, a top security body said on Friday.

newsitem: Ukraine bans Telegram use due to spying concerns
description: The National Security and Defence Council announced the restrictions after Kyrylo Budanov, head of Ukraine's GUR military intelligence agency, presented the Council with evidence of Russian special services' ability to snoop on the platform, it said in a statement.

newsitem: Ukraine bans Telegram use due to spying concerns
description: But Andriy Kovalenko, head of the security council's centre on countering disinformation, posted on Telegram that the restrictions apply only to official devices, not personal phones.

newsitem: Ukraine bans Telegram use due to spying concerns
description: Telegram is heavily used in both Ukraine and Russia and has become a critical source of information since the Russian invasion of Ukraine in February 2022.

newsitem: Ukraine bans Telegram use due to spying concerns
description: But Ukrainian security officials had repeatedly voiced concerns about its use during the war.

newsitem: Ukraine bans Telegram use due to spying concerns
description: Based in Dubai, Telegram was founded by Russian-born Pavel Durov, who left Russia in 2014 after refusing to comply with demands to shut down opposition communities on his social media platform VKontakte, which he has sold.

newsitem: Ukraine bans Telegram use due to spying concerns
description: Durov was arrested upon landing in France in August as part of an investigation into crimes related to child pornography, drug trafficking and fraudulent transactions on Telegram.

newsitem: Ukraine bans Telegram use due to spying concerns
description: The Security Council statement said Budanov had provided evidence that Russian special services could access Telegram messages, including deleted ones, as well as users' personal data.

newsitem: Ukraine bans Telegram use due to spying concerns
description: "I have always supported and continue to support freedom of speech, but the issue of Telegram is not a matter of freedom of speech, it is a matter of national security," Budanov said in his own statement.

title: US SEC intends to seek sanctions against Elon Musk in Twitter probe

newsitem: US SEC intends to seek sanctions against Musk
description: The US Securities and Exchange Commission said on Friday it intends to seek sanctions against Elon Musk after he failed to appear for court-ordered testimony for the regulator's probe into his $44 billion takeover of Twitter.

newsitem: US SEC intends to seek sanctions against Musk
description: In a filing in San Francisco federal court, the SEC said the sanctions motion would seek an order to show cause for why Musk should not be held in civil contempt for waiting until three hours before the scheduled Sept 10 testimony to advise he would not show up.

newsitem: US SEC intends to seek sanctions against Musk
description: Musk, whose businesses include electric car maker Tesla and rocket company SpaceX and who is the world's richest person, went to Florida's Cape Canaveral that day to oversee the launch of SpaceX's Polaris Dawn mission.

newsitem: US SEC intends to seek sanctions against Musk
description: But the SEC said that as SpaceX's chief technical officer, Musk "surely was already aware" of the planned launch because the company had discussed it two days earlier. It said Musk's actions violated a May 31 court order compelling his testimony.

newsitem: US SEC intends to seek sanctions against Musk
description: "Musk's excuse itself smacks of gamesmanship," SEC lawyer Robin Andrews wrote. "The court must make clear that Musk’s gamesmanship and delay tactics must cease."

newsitem: US SEC intends to seek sanctions against Musk
description: Alex Spiro, a lawyer for Musk, called sanctions "drastic" and unnecessary, saying Musk's absence from the launch could have endangered astronauts' lives, and that his testimony has been rescheduled for Oct 3.

newsitem: US SEC intends to seek sanctions against Musk
description: Musk's failure to testify on Sept 10 resulted from an "emergency" he did not cause, and "there is no reason to believe such an emergency will reoccur," Spiro wrote.

newsitem: US SEC intends to seek sanctions against Musk
description: An SEC spokesperson declined to comment, though the regulator said in the court filing that nothing deters Musk from failing to show up on Oct 3.

newsitem: US SEC intends to seek sanctions against Musk
description: The SEC is investigating whether Musk violated securities laws in early 2022 when he started accumulating Twitter stock.

newsitem: US SEC intends to seek sanctions against Musk
description: Musk has been criticised, including by Twitter shareholders, for waiting at least 10 days too long to disclose he was buying Twitter shares.

newsitem: US SEC intends to seek sanctions against Musk
description: Investors must disclose when they reach 5% ownership of public companies. Musk eventually disclosed a 9.2% Twitter stake, and soon thereafter offered to buy the whole company.

newsitem: US SEC intends to seek sanctions against Musk
description: In July, Musk said he misunderstood SEC disclosure requirements, and that "all indications" suggested his delay was a "mistake."

newsitem: US SEC intends to seek sanctions against Musk
description: The SEC sued last October after he missed a scheduled interview at its San Francisco office.

newsitem: US SEC intends to seek sanctions against Musk
description: Musk has said the SEC was trying to "harass" him through subpoenas.

newsitem: US SEC intends to seek sanctions against Musk
description: He has long feuded with the SEC, including after it sued him in 2018 over his Twitter posts about taking Tesla private.

newsitem: US SEC intends to seek sanctions against Musk
description: Musk settled that lawsuit by paying a $20 million fine, agreeing to have Tesla lawyers review some posts in advance, and giving up his role as Tesla's chairman.

title: UAE seeks closer AI, tech ties in Biden talks as China interest stirs US concern

newsitem: UAE seeks closer tech ties with US amid China concerns
description: President Joe Biden will host the United Arab Emirates president on Monday for a visit set to include White House talks on the Gulf state's plans for artificial intelligence, an ambitious effort also drawing interest from US geopolitical rival China.

newsitem: UAE seeks closer tech ties with US amid China concerns
description: The UAE, a wealthy oil producer and longtime security partner of the US, is hoping for greater access to American technology to build its own advanced tech industry.

newsitem: UAE seeks closer tech ties with US amid China concerns
description: G42, the state-backed technology company, has already secured a $1.5 billion investment from Microsoft, partnered with chipmaker Nvidia and is using supercomputers built by Cerebras Systems.

newsitem: UAE seeks closer tech ties with US amid China concerns
description: But the US has been concerned about the UAE's warm relationship with China and placed restrictions on exports of some American technology to the UAE and other Middle Eastern states over concerns that it could be shared with Beijing.

newsitem: UAE seeks closer tech ties with US amid China concerns
description: Under pressure from the Biden administration, G42 this year began ripping out Chinese hardware it was using and sold off Chinese investment so it could work more closely with American firms. That preceded the $1.5 billion Microsoft investment.

newsitem: UAE seeks closer tech ties with US amid China concerns
description: "We cannot let this sort of wave of technological breakthroughs pass by us and not be somehow in partnership with it," Anwar Gargash, diplomatic adviser to the UAE's president told journalists on Thursday ahead of the White House visit.

newsitem: UAE seeks closer tech ties with US amid China concerns
description: The White House has said Biden and UAE President Sheikh Mohamed bin Zayed Al Nahyan to discuss areas of deepening cooperation like advanced technology, artificial intelligence, investments and space exploration.

newsitem: UAE seeks closer tech ties with US amid China concerns
description: It will be the first time a UAE president visits the White House, although Sheikh Mohamed, as crown prince of Abu Dhabi, visited the White House in 2015 to meet President Barack Obama and in 2017 to meet President Donald Trump. Sheikh Mohamed met President Biden in Jeddah, Saudi Arabia in 2022.

newsitem: UAE seeks closer tech ties with US amid China concerns
description: The UAE president is also due to meet Vice President Kamala Harris and leaders from the American business community.

newsitem: UAE seeks closer tech ties with US amid China concerns
description: AI AMBITIONS

newsitem: UAE seeks closer tech ties with US amid China concerns
description: The UAE is pouring billions of dollars into artificial intelligence, which has included the development of Arabic and Hindi language chatbot applications similar to OpenAI's ChatGPT.

newsitem: UAE seeks closer tech ties with US amid China concerns
description: Emirati officials believe the Gulf state's bet on artificial intelligence will strengthen its international clout by making it a key economic actor long after demand for oil has dried up.

newsitem: UAE seeks closer tech ties with US amid China concerns
description: "We are in a position to be a pivotal country in this new information and technology age," said Faisal Al Bannai, Sheikh Mohamed's adviser on strategic research and advanced technology.

newsitem: UAE seeks closer tech ties with US amid China concerns
description: "We think we have the ingredients to build AI that can compete globally," he told Reuters in a July interview.

newsitem: UAE seeks closer tech ties with US amid China concerns

newsitem: UAE seeks closer tech ties with US amid China concerns
description: "The last thing we want to be in, is in the future as a nation, someone telling us well, you will get the latest version or you will not get the latest version," Al Bannai said.

newsitem: UAE seeks closer tech ties with US amid China concerns
description: Although US officials are wary of the UAE's relationship with China, some believe artificial intelligence and fostering closer US-UAE technology ties is one area where Washington could drive a wedge between Abu Dhabi and Beijing.

newsitem: UAE seeks closer tech ties with US amid China concerns
description: The UAE's Minister of State for Artificial Intelligence Omar Sultan Al Olama has acknowledged that there is a need for greater alignment and engagement between the UAE and the US.

newsitem: UAE seeks closer tech ties with US amid China concerns
description: CHINA SEEKS AI PARTNERSHIP WITH UAE

newsitem: UAE seeks closer tech ties with US amid China concerns
description: "There is the willingness for us to engage," he said in a June interview, adding that Abu Dhabi was fully committed to being a long term strategic technology partner with Washington.

newsitem: UAE seeks closer tech ties with US amid China concerns
description: "We haven't been shying away from our ambitions but we're going to do it in the right way. We're going to do it through partnership. We're going to do it through transparency."

newsitem: UAE seeks closer tech ties with US amid China concerns
description: China also sees the UAE as a long-term technology partner.

newsitem: UAE seeks closer tech ties with US amid China concerns
description: During a visit to Beijing in May by Sheikh Mohamed, Chinese President Xi Jinping called on the two countries to strengthen artificial intelligence cooperation.

newsitem: UAE seeks closer tech ties with US amid China concerns
description: Chinese AI companies SenseTime, sanctioned by the US which has said it has links to China's military industrial complex, and Terminus Group, both developers of facial recognition technology, are also working in the UAE.

newsitem: UAE seeks closer tech ties with US amid China concerns
description: Terminus Group's Chief Scientist Ling Shao, who previously worked for G42, said there were many opportunities in the UAE.

newsitem: UAE seeks closer tech ties with US amid China concerns
description: But while the US government may have reservations about the UAE's pursuit of AI and ties with China, what is crucial for American industry is that the UAE has both the financial resources to fund expensive artificial intelligence research and a government committed to advancing its development.

title: Meta's AI chatbot to start speaking in the voices of Judi Dench, John Cena, others, source says

newsitem: Meta's chatbot to start speaking in voices of Judi Dench, John Cena
description: Facebook owner Meta Platforms is planning to announce this week that it has secured deals with actors, including Judi Dench, Kristen Bell and John Cena, to give voice to its Meta AI chatbot, a source familiar with the company's plans told Reuters on Monday.

newsitem: Meta's chatbot to start speaking in voices of Judi Dench, John Cena
description: The new audio feature will offer users the option to select a voice for Meta's ChatGPT-like digital assistant from a list of five celebrities, who also include Awkwafina and Keegan-Michael Key, as well as several generic voice options, the person told Reuters.

newsitem: Meta's chatbot to start speaking in voices of Judi Dench, John Cena
description: The social media giant is set to announce the audio capabilities at its annual Connect conference, which starts on Wednesday, the person said.

newsitem: Meta's chatbot to start speaking in voices of Judi Dench, John Cena
description: Meta is also expected to unveil a first version of its augmented-reality glasses at Connect this year and to discuss its road map for other hardware devices like its Ray-Ban Meta smart glasses, which last year became its first product to include an audio version of the Meta AI chatbot.

newsitem: Meta's chatbot to start speaking in voices of Judi Dench, John Cena
description: The celebrity voices will start launching in the US and other English-speaking markets this week across Meta's family of apps, which include Facebook, Instagram and WhatsApp, the source told Reuters.

newsitem: Meta's chatbot to start speaking in voices of Judi Dench, John Cena
description: Bloomberg first reported earlier this summer that Meta was in discussions with celebrities about using their voices for AI projects.

newsitem: Meta's chatbot to start speaking in voices of Judi Dench, John Cena
description: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg posted a promotional video featuring Cena on Instagram last week, showing the two men and several others engaging in stunts while wearing the Ray-Ban Meta glasses.

newsitem: Meta's chatbot to start speaking in voices of Judi Dench, John Cena

title: FAA chief says SpaceX needs to operate at 'highest level of safety'

newsitem: SpaceX must operate at 'highest level of safety': FAA chief
description: Elon Musk's SpaceX must operate at the "highest level of safety," the head of the US Federal Aviation Administration said on Tuesday as he defended a proposed $633,000 fine against the company for violating the agency's rules ahead of two launches in 2023.

newsitem: SpaceX must operate at 'highest level of safety': FAA chief
description: "SpaceX has been a very innovative company," FAA Administrator Mike Whitaker said in a hearing before a US House of Representatives subcommittee. "They've been around 20 years, and I think they need to operate at the highest level of safety and that includes adopting (safety management system) programme, that includes having a whistleblower programme."

newsitem: SpaceX must operate at 'highest level of safety': FAA chief
description: "They launched without a permit," Whitaker said, referring to SpaceX launches in June and July of last year in Cape Canaveral, Florida. "It's the only tool we have to get compliance on safety matters ... I think safety is in the public interest, and that's our primary focus."

newsitem: SpaceX must operate at 'highest level of safety': FAA chief
description: The FAA said SpaceX's violations included a failure to obtain approval to revise the communications plan related to its licence for the June 2023 launch of a rocket carrying an Indonesian telecommunications satellite.

newsitem: SpaceX must operate at 'highest level of safety': FAA chief
description: Whitaker also defended a delay of the forthcoming Starship 5 launch, noting that SpaceX had failed to complete a timely sonic boom analysis. The FAA said this month that it did not expect a determination on a licence before late November.

newsitem: SpaceX must operate at 'highest level of safety': FAA chief
description: "The delay of the Starship (launch) had to do with SpaceX filing an application and not disclosing that they were in violation of Texas and federal law on some matters, and that's a requirement to get a permit," Whitaker said.

newsitem: SpaceX must operate at 'highest level of safety': FAA chief
description: Asked how SpaceX could move up the launch, Whitaker said: "Complying with the regulations would be the best path."

newsitem: SpaceX must operate at 'highest level of safety': FAA chief
description: SpaceX did not immediately respond to a request for comment.

newsitem: SpaceX must operate at 'highest level of safety': FAA chief

newsitem: SpaceX must operate at 'highest level of safety': FAA chief
description: Whitaker told reporters he had not seen Musk's social media post and declined to say if he had spoken to the billionaire. But Whitaker agreed that space companies should be treated equally.

newsitem: SpaceX must operate at 'highest level of safety': FAA chief
description: "I think Boeing and SpaceX should have the same oversight. They should all have SMS (safety management systems). They should all have whistleblower programmes," Whitaker said.

newsitem: Meta unveils prototype AR glasses at Connect event
description: Facebook owner Meta Platforms showed off its first working prototype of augmented-reality glasses, called Orion, during its annual Connect conference at its California headquarters on Wednesday, along with updates to its existing virtual-reality and artificial-intelligence products.

newsitem: Meta unveils prototype AR glasses at Connect event
description: "This is the physical world with holograms overlaid on," Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg said after pulling out the chunky black glasses from a metal case dramatically brought to him on stage.

newsitem: Meta unveils prototype AR glasses at Connect event
description: The company's shares were up nearly 2% on Wednesday afternoon.

description: Meta also announced a slew of software enhancements to the AI assistant that has driven interest in the Ray-Ban Meta smart glasses, making it possible for users, for example, to scan QR codes and stream music from Spotify in response to voice prompts.

newsitem: Trump campaign turns to secure hardware after hacking incident
description: Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump’s campaign is now using specialised, encrypted mobile phones and secure laptops in an effort to protect staff following a series of successful Iranian hacks and two attempts to assassinate the former president.

newsitem: Trump campaign turns to secure hardware after hacking incident
description: The campaign recently purchased a package of these devices from Santa Barbara, California-based Green Hills Software, the developer of a proprietary, security-focused operating system already used by multiple US agencies, the company's CEO told Reuters.

newsitem: Trump campaign turns to secure hardware after hacking incident

newsitem: Tesla's robotaxi design puzzles experts
description: Tesla's reveal of a robotaxi designed as a low-slung, two-seater, sporty coupe - quite the opposite of a typical taxi with room for several passengers and luggage - flummoxed investors and analysts.

newsitem: Tesla's robotaxi design puzzles experts
description: CEO Elon Musk served up the cool design for the prototype of the Tesla robotaxi, dubbed Cybercab, at a much-hyped event near Los Angeles late on Thursday. These will go into production some time in 2026 and cost less than $30,000 a pop, he said.

newsitem: Tesla's robotaxi design puzzles experts
description: But in true Musk style, he skipped over expectations of how a two-seater robotaxi would serve the needs of families headed to a restaurant or to the airport, or if he expected these to appeal only to a niche clientele.

newsitem: Tesla's robotaxi design puzzles experts
description: Investors jeered the design and the lack of financial detail, with Tesla stocks tumbling 9% on Wall Street on Friday.

newsitem: Tesla's robotaxi design puzzles experts

newsitem: Tesla's robotaxi design puzzles experts
description: Tesla did not respond to an email seeking comment.

newsitem: Tesla's robotaxi design puzzles experts
description: Experts said robotaxis would best emulate regular taxis with plenty of room, a tall design and sliding doors. Musk did showcase a futuristic robovan that could seat up to 20 people but did not say when that would be available.

newsitem: Tesla's robotaxi design puzzles experts

newsitem: Tesla's robotaxi design puzzles experts
description: Waymo has a fleet of about 700 Jaguar Land Rover cars that fit four passengers, same as the seating capacity in Amazon's Zoox robotaxis.

newsitem: Tesla's robotaxi design puzzles experts

newsitem: Tesla's robotaxi design puzzles experts
description: Delivering the robotaxi and capturing a still nascent and tightly regulated market will be critical for Tesla.

newsitem: Tesla's robotaxi design puzzles experts
